result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick L. Young Jr.

No record.  Defendant Patrick L. Young Jr. not in court.  Attorney Brenda L VanCuick not in court.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM. Atty VanCuick in trial.  FPT set over to 1/4 10am/ scheduled in person with Atty VanCuick.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patrick L. Young Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Brenda L VanCuick in court for Patrick L. Young Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

147PM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on September 22, 2022 at 09:15 am before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued.  sg
